questions.subject: mathematics
questions.questionText: Which of the following is true?
options: A. {0, 2, 6, 9, 12} is a subset of even numbers.
B. {-1, 0, 2, 3, 5} is a subset of odd numbers.
C. {-2, -1, 1, 3, 9} is a subset of integers.
D. {2, 3, 5, 7, 27} is a subset of prime numbers.
E. {9, 18, 21, 27, 36} is a subset of multiples of 9.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is not an integer?

questions.questionText: Mensah packed 1,800 apples into a number of boxes. If each box contained 120 apples, how many boxes were fully packed?

questions.questionText: The sum of 5 and x divided by 4 is equal to 3.25. Find the value of x.

questions.questionText: Find the least number that must be added to 308 to make it divisible by 19.

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.questionText: Arrange the following integers from the least to the highest -4,9,-10,-7,and 2.

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.questionText: A number of oranges are shared among 50 students and each got 15 oranges. If the same number of oranges are shared equally among 30 students, how many will each student get?

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.questionText: In a class of 24 pupils, 10 study French only and 8 study English only. If each pupil studies at least one of the two subjects, how many study English?

questions.questionText: Express 2700 as a product of prime numbers.

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.questionText: In an examination, Abu answered nine questions in 2 hours. He spent 20 minutes on the first question and the same time on each of the remaining questions. How many minutes did he spend on each of the other question?

questions.subject: mathematics
questions.questionText: If the set P = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} which of the following statements best describes P?
options: A. Set of whole numbers up to 6
B. Set of counting numbers less than 6
C. Set of counting numbers greater than 6
D. Set of integers less than 6

questions.questionText: If M = {Multiples of 4 between 10 and 25} and N = {even numbers between 11 and 23}, find M∪N.

questions.questionText: What is the total cost of x shirts at GH₵ 5.00 each and y shirts at GH₵ 1.50 each?

questions.questionText: A frog leaps in such a way that its distance, in metres, from its starting position after each leap is given by 4, 7, 10, ... Find its distance from the starting position after the 10th leap.

questions.questionText: If one-third of a number is added to one-fifth of the same number, the result is 8. Find the number.

questions.questionText: An amount of GH₵ 375,000.00 was needed to build a clinic for a community of twelve towns. Each community contributed GH₵ 25,000.00. If the District Assembly also contributed GH₵ 30,500.00, how much more is needed to build the clinic?
